bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from the British Consulate General to Wickliffe Rose, July 27, 1923

div1.p: The Vice Consul of the British Consulate General writes to inform Rose of a fatal case of yellow fever occurring in Sekondi, Gold Coast.

div1.head: Letter from the British Consulate General to Wickliffe Rose, July 27, 1923
div1.opener:
Copy
British Consulate General
New York
July 27, 1923
Sir:
div1.p:
I have to inform you that the following case
of yellow fever has come to my notice:

1 at Sekondi, Gold Coast,
week ended 5th July last.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Vice Consul Mr. Wickliffe Rose
International Health Board
Rockefeller Foundation
61 Broadway
New York City
